and then my instagram has a lot of

took
fat from my leg
and put it on my chest
and they went what that's a thing what
you can do that and i said yes it's
called
fat grafting what is fat grafting yep
and how do you do it so it sounds a
little bit like science fiction you know
we're taking fat from one part of the
body and moving it somewhere else yes so
so basically what happened is when you
came to see me you were interested in a
breast revision surgery and you had
prior saline breast implants yes and
when you came in you thought maybe you
needed a lift and new implants and then
when i saw you i was looking at what
your goals were and your anatomy and to
me it made sense that you didn't really
need implants anymore because you had
tissue soft tissue of your own natural
tissue meaning fat that i could transfer
to the breast to get the the look that
you wanted what i find is a lot of
patients going into surgeons if the
surgeon doesn't really have a full array
of techniques they're just going to get
the same thing offered every time like
implant implants
right and right and you know implants
are wonderful when you need them for
people who don't have enough natural
tissue and they want volume or you need
to reshape the breast an implant can be
very helpful but if you already have
enough of your own natural tissue i'd
prefer to do an all-natural breast
surgery so that you don't have the the
maintenance of implants over time so
basically you have fat cells throughout
your body obviously and then some areas
are more diet resistant than others so
diet resistant fat tends to be like
in in men it's usually the stomach and
love handles okay women it tends to be
maybe more love handles and thighs and
it's just an area where it's the last
area of fat to go when you lose weight
so those are the best fat cells because
they're the ones that kind of stay
stable the longest so generally when i'm
doing fat grafting what i'm doing is i'm
looking at areas of the body where
somebody has more fat than they want
aesthetically speaking and it's good
quality fat you do liposuction to remove
fat from those areas
then the fats process and purified i use
a system called pure graft where the fat
goes from your body through the cannula
which is the metal tube that you do
liposuction through tubing into a filter
and inside the filter i can wash the fat
and then draw the fat back up after i
get rid of all the oils and impurities
and things you don't want and then i
re-inject it back into wherever i want
the fat to go so the fats never expose
the environment it's a very clean
sterile system and so you're borrowing
fat from areas where you don't need the
fat and then after you process it you
plug it back into a new area now what
you're not doing is injecting big blobs
of fat each thin thread of fat is
basically just a little bit of fat cells
that's mixed in with the rest of the
tissue and the blood supply and the
surrounding tissue keeps those fat cells
alive one thing i always tell patients
when we're talking about fat grafting is
it's not as predictable as an implant in
the sense that like let's say somebody
wants to be 300 cc's bigger you can open
up an implant that's 300 cc's put it in
you have 300 cc's with fat grafting we
don't know exactly how much fat we're
going to get out when we do the surgery
of the fat that comes out not all of
that fat is good enough to put back in
after it's processed and purified and
then of the fat that goes back into the
new area not all of it will stay
permanently so usually about 60 to
what's injected will stay and 40 will
reabsorb sometimes more sometimes less
it depends on the patient's genetics and
a bunch of other factors literally
almost 100 percent of time if i have
people come in with like a spouse or
whatever usually the spouse will say
i'll donate you know as a joke but
you can't get fat from somebody else
because it's not your genetics so you
would reject it but if it's your own fat
you can take it from one area of body
and stick it in another area that's
totally fine so you can't be a fat donor
unfortunately even though we get that
offer all the time you guys i can't tell
you how fascinated i am by this
technique 14 years ago when i did
augmentation i didn't know
that this even existed it was much less
common 14 years ago so that that was
sort of like a it was more of an
emerging technology and technique
nowadays i think if you're not doing fat
grafting you're depriving patients of a
really important tool so like when i
talk to patients about fat grafting
versus implants i always say you know
the pros and cons you have to weigh out
both so with implants you have
predictability you don't need any
alternative surgery sites because you're
not harvesting anything so that's the
upside is that you know you know how
much volume you have and you can just
open a box and the volume is there you
don't have to take it from other parts
of the body the downside is implants
have more maintenance involved you have
to switch them out periodically during
your lifetime there's certain
complications that can happen with
implants that you wouldn't get without
an implant like capsular contracture
where you get scar hardened with the fat
grafting you know the pros are that it's
all natural so there's a lot of
maintenance um and then the the fact
that you have to take it from other body
areas is both a pro and a con because
you have some soreness from liposuction
but usually people are happier with
where they how they look in the areas
where you take the fat from so it's kind
of like a double bonus and then you're
taking fat from here you don't want it
sticking where you do want it that's
kind of a win-win so that's the main
advantage of fat grafting is the natural
element of it and the fact that you get
improvements from the liposuction

basically for the surgery obviously you

and they always say am i going to wake

have to understand is that you know with

they're going to be top level training
and i we hand pick the best of the best

safe i always tell patients
statistically speaking the most
dangerous thing to do in the day of
surgery is drive to the office for your

not paralyzed for the surgery so you're
breathing on your own but you're deep
enough under anesthesia you're totally
unaware of what's going on we have to
worry about you waking up and not being
able to know because if you even
slightly start getting lighter under

go up or you'll kind of shift a tiny bit
way before your brain is aware of what's

surgery is over it's the medications are
keeping the sleep so as soon as they

body will naturally wake up so it's not

think that's important stuff to know

first thing i did was i removed the old

it kills bacterial biofilm so there's
any kind of bacterial contamination at

worried about certain issues that
there's a very rare type of cancer it
can be associated with textured implants
there are certain situations where yes
it's appropriate to take the capsule out
but if the capsule is super super thin
all taking the capsule out does is it
creates more soreness more chance for
bleeding and also having the skin here
and the capsule there with the tissue in
between that gives us a sandwiching

grafting it's kind of held in place you
don't have to worry about any of the fat

it's kind of all the early stuff
